llm_text:
Why:
- payment_format_ach = 1 was the dominant driver (SHAP +3.03318, direction: increase), so the model raised the score primarily because this is an ACH payment.
- payment_currency_saudi_riyal = 1 (SHAP +0.571676, increase) and receiving_currency_saudi_riyal = 1 (SHAP +0.257559, increase) further increased the score, i.e., the payment being in Saudi riyal contributed to the flag.
- amount_received = 30072.8 (SHAP +0.322905, increase) also pushed the score upward, indicating the transaction magnitude contributed.
- from_bank = 48308 (SHAP -0.416701, decrease) partially offset the increase (the sending bank feature reduced the model score).

Conclusion:
The transaction was flagged mainly because it is an ACH payment in Saudi riyal for ~30,072.8 (features: payment_format_ach, payment_currency_saudi_riyal, receiving_currency_saudi_riyal, amount_received). The specific sending bank (from_bank) reduced the modelâ€™s concern but not enough to prevent the flag. If ACH payments in SAR at this magnitude are treated as higher-risk by the model, that pattern explains the alert.
